poem:
Title: "Of Dogs and Men"

Man as canine, or Dog as brother,
Science stumbles, becomes another 
Mischievous child, caught in a lie,
Ubiquitous with its wayward cry.
Depicting tales of tails and genes,
Like a pantomime in hazed-up dreams. 
Yet in our hearts, the truth dwelling, 
In laughter's bark, the truth is telling. 
Man or dog, what matter the slight?
In DNA, we all take flight.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pet DNA testing company in doghouse after identifying human as canine A pet company has twice sent back dog breed results for human swab samples, prompting doubts surrounding the accuracy of dog breed tests. Related: The pet I’ll never forget: Mickey the spaniel, scourge of park-keepers On Wednesday, WBZ News reported its investigations team receiving dog breed results from the company DNA My Dog after one of its reporters sent in a swab sample –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Pet DNA testing company in doghouse after identifying human as canine A pet company has twice sent back dog breed results for human swab samples, prompting doubts surrounding the accuracy of dog breed tests.
